alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 2:38PM CDT until July 02 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following areas, Cook, DuPage and Lake IL. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Underpasses may be flooded. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 234 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated a slow-moving band of heavy rainfall moving onshore from Lake Michigan producing rainfall rates of 0.5 to 1 inch per hour. Ponding of water may occur quickly, especially in areas that received heavy rainfall earlier this morning. - Some locations that may experience minor flooding include... Highland Park, Northbrook, Wilmette, Des Plaines, Elmhurst, Downers Grove, Lombard. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
